item.title: AP analysis: Presidents are taking longer to approve disaster aid. For some, the wait is agonizing
item.description: Disaster survivors are waiting longer for federal aid. A new Associated Press analysis found that itâ€™s taking more than a month, on average, for President Donald Trump to approve major disaster declarations after receiving requests.

item.title: Takeaways from an AP analysis about longer delays in approving US disaster aid
Most US adults think individual choices keep people in poverty, new AP-NORC/Harris poll finds
